main event: An unidentified flying object was reported in Mansfield, Ohio on August 16, 1966, showing erratic movements and luminous characteristics.
interesting points: The object was observed moving rapidly from south-west to north-east and sometimes hovered in place., Observers included Dan R. Haber and his two daughters., Witnesses described the object as a brilliant yellow light with self-luminescence., The Air Force concluded that there was insufficient data for evaluation., The sightings corresponded with a barium cloud release experiment conducted by German and American scientists.
witness description: Dan R. Haber and his two daughters
